TopicTitle: SpaceX Rocket Launch tonight! Check it out East Coast!

Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

If you live in the USA on the Eastern Seaboard, keep your eye to the south/southeast tonight around 8:30. The SpaceX unmanned vehicle with the Dragon capsule headed for ISS. This launch will be visible to most of the Eastern Seaboard due to the inclination of ISS's orbit, the rocket will be flying pretty much parallel to the Eastern Seaboard.

Check It Out!

There is already a thread to discuss sort of thing here: Here

This is also in the wrong section, it should be in the Science Labs, just helping you out.

Still I'm looking forward to it even though it's 01:35 AM and I've got school in the morning (I'm sorely tempted to stay up).

P.S: In my thread, I update it with the latest news/pictures on the mission if you want to check that out.
